entries.title: How do you make a mummy? Ancient Egyptians’ surprising formulas revealed
entries.description: The discovery of an unusual set of ceramic vessels has shed new light on the mummification process in ancient Egypt, according to a new study.

entries.title: E.U.’s von der Leyen: Russia must be held accountable ‘for its odious crimes’
entries.description: “Prosecutors from Ukraine and the European Union are already working together,” said the European Commission President on a visit to Kyiv, where she also praised President Zelenskyy’s “impressive progress” towards E.U. membership.

entries.title: El Salvador opens one of Latin America's largest prisons
entries.description: El Salvador has opened one of Latin America’s largest prisons, more than doubling the country’s incarceration capacity amid Pres. Bukele's crackdown on gangs.

entries.title: Biden administration transfers Guantanamo detainee Majid Khan
entries.description: The Biden administration resettled Guantanamo detainee Majid Khan in Belize on Thursday and is preparing to move at least two other men, said officials.

entries.title: Ukraine warns Putin has amassed troops for a major and imminent offensive
entries.description: As Russia’s invasion of Ukraine nears the one-year mark, Kyiv is sounding an increasingly urgent warning: Vladimir Putin is preparing a major new offensive that could be launched in the coming weeks.

entries.title: U.S. strengthens military ties to counter growing Chinese threat
entries.description: During a visit to the Philippines, Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin spoke about "modernizing" the military alliance between Manila and Washington to counter China's "illegitimate claims."

entries.title: A U.S. short seller's fraud claims dethroned Asia's richest man. Here's what to know.
entries.description: Indian business tycoon Gautum Adani has lost tens of billions of dollars and his title as Asia’s richest man after short-selling firm Hindenburg accused him of fraud.

entries.title: Angry scenes outside Cardinal Pell's funeral as mourners hear him called a victim
entries.description: Mourners at the Sydney funeral for Australian Cardinal George Pell, who was once the most senior Catholic convicted of sex abuse, remembered him as a victim of a campaign to punish him regardless of his guilt. Meanwhile, a few hundred protesters yelled slogans from the street denouncing the staunch conservative.

entries.title: Australia will not feature King Charles III on new $5 bills
entries.description: Australians reacted mostly positively after the nation’s central bank said its new $5 bill would feature an Indigenous design rather than an image of King Charles III.

entries.title: Indian billionaire Gautam Adani calls off $2.5 billion share sale
entries.description: Gautam Adani called off his flagship company's $2.5 billion share sale after his conglomerate shed tens of billions of dollars in market value following claims of fraud by short-seller, Hindenburg Research.

entries.title: Australia is removing the British monarch from its bank notes
entries.description: Australia is removing the British monarchy from its bank notes.

entries.title: North Korea warns of ‘overwhelming nuclear force’ to counter U.S.
entries.description: North Korea said it is prepared to counter U.S. military moves with the “most overwhelming nuclear force” as it warned against joint drills with the South.

entries.title: U.S. expands military presence in the Philippines as China looms in region
entries.description: The United States and the Philippines announced plans to expand America’s military presence in the Southeast Asian nation, with access to four more bases.

entries.title: U.S. opens embassy in Solomon Islands in bid to counter China
entries.description: The United States opened an embassy in the Solomon Islands on Thursday in its latest move to counter China’s push into the Pacific.

entries.title: Mourners and protesters clash at Cardinal George Pell’s funeral in Sydney
entries.description: Mourners clashed with protesters at the Sydney funeral for Australian Cardinal George Pell, who was once the most senior Catholic convicted of sex abuse.
